revised_title: Science and Politics: The Role of International Cooperation and Scholarly Exchange
tldr: The author discusses the importance of international cooperation and solidarity among scholars during World War II. They emphasize the need for the United States to support British scholarship and democracy, as well as welcoming German and Italian scientists who fled their home countries due to ideological restrictions. The author also highlights the potential for learning from past failures and promoting a new international organization to ensure peace and prosperity for all mankind.
